thread.title: Mum-of-four plans to move out of council house and buy her first home after scooping £14.5 Euromillions jackpot - Mirror Online
thread.title_full: Mum-of-four plans to move out of council house and buy her first home after scooping £14.5 Euromillions jackpot - Mirror Online

author: Richard Wheatstone
title: Mum-of-four plans to move out of council house and buy her first home after scooping £14.5 Euromillions jackpot - Mirror Online
text:
Beverley Doran scooped £14.5m in last Friday's Euromillions (Photo: PA) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A mum-of-four says she will buy her first family home after scooping a massive £14.5 Euromillions jackpot. 
Beverley Doran, from Shipley, West Yorkshire, said she "fell to the floor" when she found out she'd scooped the huge jackpot prize. 
She is now planning to move out of her family's council home and purchase her own property with her multi-million pound fortune. 
The only snag for the 37-year-old when it came to celebrate the massive win is that she's allergic to champagne. The mum-of-four now plans to move out of her council house (Photo: PA) 
Beverley claimed the total £14,509,500 jackpot after matching the five main numbers and two Lucky Stars in last Friday's draw. 
Her Euromillions winning numbers were 25, 19, 33, 36, 48 and the Lucky Stars were 2, 9. 
More follows.
